org.arl.fjage

Class Platform

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.arl.fjage.Platform
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TimestampProvider
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DiscreteEventSimulator, RealTimePlatform

    public abstract class Platform
extends java.lang.Object
implements TimestampProvider
    Base class for platforms on which agent containers run. The platform provides basic system functionality such as timing, network, etc.

    • Method Detail

      • currentTimeMillis

        public abstract long currentTimeMillis()
        Gets the current platform time in milliseconds. For real-time platforms, this time is epoch time. For simulation platforms, this time is simulation time.
        Specified by:
        currentTimeMillis in interface TimestampProvider
        Returns:
        time in milliseconds.

      • nanoTime

        public abstract long nanoTime()
        Gets the current platform time in nanoseconds. For real-time platforms, this time is epoch time. For simulation platforms, this time is simulation time. This time is nanosecond precision, but not necessarily nanosecond accuracy.
        Specified by:
        nanoTime in interface TimestampProvider
        Returns:
        time in nanoseconds.

      • schedule

        public abstract void schedule(java.util.TimerTask task,
                              long millis)
        Schedules a task to be executed at a given platform time.
        Parameters:
        task - task to be executed.
        millis - time at which to execute the task.

      • idle

        public abstract void idle()
        Internal method called by a container when all agents are idle.

      • delay

        public abstract void delay(long millis)
        Delays execution by a specified number of milliseconds of platform time.
        Parameters:
        millis - number of milliseconds to delay execution.

      • addContainer

        public void addContainer(Container container)
        Adds a container to the platform. This method is typically called automatically by containers when they are created.
        Parameters:
        container - the container.

      • getContainers

        public Container[] getContainers()
        Gets all the containers on the platform.
        Returns:
        an array of containers.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts all containers on the platform.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Terminates all containers on the platform.

      • setHostname

        public void setHostname(java.lang.String hostname)
        Sets the hostname for the platform.
        Parameters:
        hostname - name of the host.
        See Also:
        getHostname()

      • getHostname

        public java.lang.String getHostname()
        Gets the hostname for the platform. If the hostname is not set or set to null, it is automatically determined from the Internet hostname for the machine.
        Returns:
        the name of the host.

      • getNetworkInterface

        public java.net.NetworkInterface getNetworkInterface()
        Gets a network interface that the platform is bound to.
        Returns:
        bound network interface, null if no binding.

      • setNetworkInterface

        public void setNetworkInterface(java.lang.String name)
                         throws java.net.SocketException
        Sets the network interface to bind to.
        Parameters:

      • setPort

        @Deprecated
public void setPort(int port)
        Deprecated. As of release 1.4, RMI support has been deprecated.
        Sets the TCP/IP port for platforms supporting remote connections. This defaults to 1099, the Java RMI port.
        Parameters:
        port - TCP/IP port number.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if remote connections are not supported.

      • getPort

        @Deprecated
public int getPort()
        Deprecated. As of release 1.4, RMI support has been deprecated.
        Gets the TCP/IP port for platforms supporting remote connections. This defaults to 1099, the Java RMI port.
        Returns:
        TCP/IP port number
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if remote connections are not supported.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Check if any container on the platform is running.
        Returns:
        true if a container is running, false otherwise.

      • isIdle

        public boolean isIdle()
        Check if all containers on the platform are idle.
        Returns:
        true if all containers are idle, false otherwise.
